standard_metadata.standard_description: Draw points, lines, line segments, rays, angles (right, acute, obtuse), and perpendicular and parallel lines. Identify these in two-dimensional figures.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Identify points, lines, line segments, rays, and angles

images.alt: A straight mark with dots on each end.
A straight mark with arrows on each end pointing outward in opposite directions.
A dot labeled C.
A dot labeled D with two arrows extending from it, one arrow going slightly upward and the other going slightly downward.

hints.content: A *point* is an exact location. It has no size, only position.
Which image shows an exact location or position?
[[â˜ƒ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot labeled C.
A straight mark with dots on each end.
A straight mark with arrows on each end pointing outward in opposite directions.
A dot with two arrows extending from it, one arrow going to the left and passes through a dot and the other going to the right and passes through a dot.
A dot labeled D with two arrows extending from it, one arrow going slightly upward and the other going slightly downward.

hints.content: A *point* is an exact location. It has no size, only position.
Which image shows an exact location or position?
None of the figures show an exact location or position.

images.alt: A straight mark with dots on each end.
A straight mark with arrows on each end pointing outward in opposite directions.
A dot labeled C.
A dot labeled B with an arrow extending from it and passing through another dot, labeled A.

hints.content: A *ray* is perfectly straight, starts at one point and goes on forever in one direction.
Which image shows a line that is perfectly straight, starts at one point and goes on forever in one direction?
[[â˜ƒ image 1]]

images.alt: A dot labeled B with an arrow extending from it and passing through another dot, labeled A.
A straight mark with dots on each end.
A straight mark with arrows on each end pointing outward in opposite directions.
A dot labeled C.

Two long straight marks with arrows on their ends extend from a dot. One long straight mark extends to the right and passes through a dot. The other long straight mark extends down and to the left and passes through a dot. Three blue arcs connect these two long straight marks.

hints.content: A *ray* is perfectly straight, starts at one point and goes on forever in one direction.
Which image shows a line that is perfectly straight, starts at one point and goes on forever in one direction?
None of the figures show a line that is perfectly straight, starts at one point and goes on forever in one direction.

images.alt: A dot labeled A.
A straight mark with arrows on each end pointing outward in opposite directions.
A straight mark with dots on each end. One dot is labeled A and the other dot is labeled B.
A dot labeled D with an arrow extending from it.

hints.content: A *line* is perfectly straight and extends forever in both directions.
Which image shows a line that is perfectly straight and extends forever in both directions?
[[â˜ƒ image 1]]

images.alt: A straight mark with arrows on each end pointing outward in opposite directions.
A dot labeled A.
A dot labeled D with two arrows extending from it, one arrow going slightly upward and the other going slightly downward.
A straight mark with dots on each end. One dot is labeled A and the other dot is labeled B.
A dot labeled D with an arrow extending from it.

hints.content: A *line* is perfectly straight and extends forever in both directions.
Which image shows a line that is perfectly straight and extends forever in both directions?
None of the figures show a line that is perfectly straight and extends forever in both directions.

question.content: **Which of these is a line segment?**

images.alt: A dot labeled C.
A straight mark with arrows on each end pointing outward in opposite directions.
A dot labeled B with two arrows extending from it, one arrow going slightly upward and the other going slightly downward.
A straight mark with dots on each end. One dot is labeled A and the other dot is labeled B.

hints.content: A *line segment* is perfectly straight, starts at one point and ends at another point.
Which image shows a line that is perfectly straight, starts at one point and ends at another point?
[[â˜ƒ image 1]]

images.alt: A straight mark with dots on each end. One dot is labeled A and the other dot is labeled B.

question.content: **Which of these is a line segment?**

images.alt: A dot labeled C.
A straight mark with arrows on each end pointing outward in opposite directions.
A dot labeled B with two arrows extending from it, one arrow going slightly upward and the other going slightly downward.
A dot with two arrows extending from it, one arrow going downward and to the right and passes through a dot and the other going upward and to the left and passes through a dot.

hints.content: A *line segment* is perfectly straight, starts at one point and ends at another point.
Which image shows a line that is perfectly straight, starts at one point and ends at another point?
None of the figures show a line that is perfectly straight, starts at one point and ends at another point.

images.alt: A straight mark with arrows on each end pointing outward in opposite directions.

Two long straight marks with arrows on each end pointing outward in opposite directions intersect at a dot labeled B. One long straight mark extends down and slightly to the right from dot labeled B and passes through a dot labeled C. The other long straight mark extends left and slightly down from dot labeled B and passes through a dot labeled A.
A dot labeled L.
A straight mark with dots on each end. One dot is labeled A and the other dot is labeled B.

hints.content: An *angle* is the figure formed by two rays meeting at a common end point.
Which image shows a figure formed by two rays meeting at a common end point?
[[â˜ƒ image 1]]

images.alt: Two long straight marks with arrows on each end pointing outward in opposite directions intersect at a dot labeled B. One long straight mark extends down and slightly to the right from dot labeled B and passes through a dot labeled C. The other long straight mark extends left and slightly down from dot labeled B and passes through a dot labeled A.
A straight mark with arrows on each end pointing outward in opposite directions.
A straight mark with dots on each end. One dot is labeled A and the other dot is labeled B.
A dot labeled X.
A straight mark with arrows on each end pointing outward in opposite directions.

hints.content: An *angle* is the figure formed by two rays meeting at a common end point.
Which image shows a figure formed by two rays meeting at a common end point?
None of the figures show two rays meeting at a common end point.

images.alt: A flat shape has four sides and four corners. Its opposite sides are equal in length and extend in the same direction.

hints.content: Term | Definition - | - | - Angle | An *angle* is the figure formed by two rays meeting at a common end point. Line  | A *line* is perfectly straight and extends forever in both directions. Line segment | A *line segment* is perfectly straight, starts at one point and ends at another point. Point| A *point* is an exact location. It has no size, only position. Ray | A *ray* is perfectly straight, starts at one point and goes on forever in one direction
Which definition describes the figure?
None of the definitions describe the figure.

images.alt: A long mark extends in the downward left direction, then curves and extends in the upward right direction, then curves again and extends in the downward left direction. The arrow on its left end points along its direction.

hints.content: Term | Definition - | - | - Angle | An *angle* is the figure formed by two rays meeting at a common end point. images.alt: A dot labeled C.

hints.content: Term | Definition - | - | - Angle | An *angle* is the figure formed by two rays meeting at a common end point. Line  | A *line* is perfectly straight and extends forever in both directions. Line segment | A *line segment* is perfectly straight, starts at one point and ends at another point. Point| A *point* is an exact location. It has no size, only position. Ray | A *ray* is perfectly straight, starts at one point and goes on forever in one direction
Which definition describes the figure?
The figure is an exact location. It has no size, only position.
The figure is a *point*.

Four purple arcs connect these two long straight marks.
